bibl.title: Moy Wah v. J. C. Drake. Original Certificate
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington

div1.p: I, Moy Wah, being first duly sworn say:- That I am, and have been for six years last past a resident of Portland Oregon; That I am a chinese merchant, and a member of the firm of of Gum WINGChung & Co. that the said firm are chinese merchants duing b buisness at No. 168 Fifth Street, Portland Oregon.

That I am about to depart from the United States on buisness cojnec- ted with my firm, and this certificate is made for the purpose of assisting me to land on my return; that the annexed photograph is of myself and this certificate will not be used by any other perso
Subscribed and sworn to before me this ) Twentysecond (22) day of January A.D. 1892.)

We, the under signed residents of Portland Oregon hereby certify, that we are acquainted with Moy Wah of the firm of Gum Wing Chung & Co., and whose photograph is attached to the annexed paper; the said firm, Gum Wing Chung &Co., is at this time duing buisness at No. 168 Fifth street, Portland Oregon.

That we believe the said Moy Wah is about to depart from the Uni ted States and this certificate is made for the purpose of assis- ting him to identify himself to the Custom House officers on his return to the United States
State of Oregon, County of Multnoman,
I, Frank G, Harrington, being first duly sworn say, that certificate, No 5I83 (in blue), dated the 22 day of Janurary, 1892, with my signature, was signed by me.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 4th, day of may, 1893.
